children.name: Using ancient fossils and new methods to unravel Australian mammal evolution in deep time

data.description: This project will explore the evolution of Australia's unique mammal fauna by studying fossil mammals recently discovered at Tingamarra, a 55 million year old fossil site in north-eastern Queensland. In particular, it will help us understand the origin, radiation and diversification of Australia's iconic marsupials.
data.scientific_title: Using ancient fossils and new methods to unravel Australian mammal evolution in deep time

children.name: The University of New South Wales

data.name: The University of New South Wales
